Pre-Game Insights: The Intuit Dome opened its doors for the first time as the Los Angeles Clippers played the Dallas Mavericks in a preseason game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The arena has been hosting concerts since August, but this is the first game in the more than $2 billion vision of Clippers owner Steve Ballmer.
Others: Derrick Jones Jr. scored 12 points in the game.
The arena has an 80,000-square-foot outdoor plaza with a basketball court that’s open to the public.
The Intuit Dome is in an area that’s exploding with sports and entertainment, less than a mile from Sofi Stadium and The Kia Forum.
